result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Hearing for 09/26/2022 hearing.  Return to sender. Not deliverable as addressed. Unable to Forward.

9:39 AM Defendant JOSEPH M. BOWEN in court.  Attorney Daniel Mark Muza in court for JOSEPH M. BOWEN.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Nash in court for the State of Wisconsin. Charges duplicate complaint.  Reading waived. Bond Continues. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Original Bench Warrant returned from Winnebago County Sheriff's Office.

BAIL JUMP-2CTS/STRANGULATION/DV/AGG BATTERY/DV/DC/DV: CONDITIONS:    No alcohol consumption or possession.   No contact with V1 in OPD report 22-20754 or their residence.  Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are.  May pick up belongings one time accompanied by police escort once 72 hour no contact is no longer in effect, provided there are no other court orders prohibiting contact.

2:50 PM  Defendant JOSEPH M. BOWEN appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer appeared by video for JOSEPH M. BOWEN.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Lynn Folger in court for the State of Wisconsin. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Court reinstates $1,000 cash bond with same conditions as previously ordered. Record closed @ 2:53.

Letter to Judge Keberlein re: Request for Hearing and to Quash Warrant. Routed to Judge to review.  09/13 per Judge the Defendant would need to turn himself in.09/13 Spoke with Atty Muza and told him his client would need to turn himself in

11:00 AM Defendant JOSEPH M. BOWEN not in court.  Attorney Daniel Mark Muza in court for JOSEPH M. BOWEN.  Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE doesn't appear, no explanation.  Bench warrant authorized.  Forfeit bond.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.

10:08 AM Prosecuting attorney Tracy Ann Paider in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant JOSEPH M. BOWEN in court.  Attorney Daniel Mark Muza in court for JOSEPH M. BOWEN. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement. Bond Continues. Record closed @ 10:11.
Arraignment scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
